fields.summary: euca-delete-bundle -m should not require a manifest file on the local machine.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.name: Closed

fields.summary: euca-delete-bundle should explicitly say when the given manifest doesn't exist

comments.body:
Upon deleting a manifest from the system, it is possible to receive the following error

The error "problem parsing: /tmp/root-2.6.32-131.0.15.el6.x86_64.img.manifest.xml"

This error causes a fair amount of confusion as it does not indicate the particular error that the user has encountered.



See output below:

[root@styx ~]# euca-deregister emi-EC6535F6
IMAGE emi-EC6535F6

[root@styx ~]# euca-delete-bundle -b rootfs_bucket -p
root-2.6.32-131.0.15.el6.x86_64.img
problem parsing: /tmp/root-2.6.32-131.0.15.el6.x86_64.img.manifest.xml

-----------------------

We have found that upon trying the delete bundle a second time, you will get this exact message!  


[root@Pod-01 ~]# euca-delete-bundle -b rootfs_bucket -p centos.5-3.x86-64.img
problem parsing: /tmp/centos.5-3.x86-64.img.manifest.xml
[root@Pod-01 ~]# 


----------------------


Recommended solution :

Change the software to test, detect and report if the target file is missing and report file or image or manifest not found. In this way the customer is not mislead into thinking that they have typed a value wrong but correctly interpret the error message to mean that the file is not present.

Tried this with Eucalyptus 3.0.2, using euca2ools version 2.0.2-0euca1.  The following behavior was observed:

{code}
# euca-deregister emi-76FA389D
IMAGE	emi-76FA389D

(run again)

# euca-deregister emi-76FA389D
IMAGE	emi-76FA389D

# euca-describe-images emi-76FA389D
#

# euca-delete-bundle -b windows2008-datacenter -p 
option -p requires argument

# euca-delete-bundle -b windows2008-datacenter -p windowsserver2008_datacenter_x64.kvm.img
#

(deletion completed successfully; bucket is empty on filesystem)

# ls -l /var/lib/eucalyptus/bukkits/windows2008-datacenter/
total 0

{code}

For extra testing, ran euca-deregister only one time.  Still got the same results:

{code}
# euca-deregister emi-F3ED3BCC
IMAGE	emi-F3ED3BCC
# euca-delete-bundle -b wind-new-2008-dc -p 
option -p requires argument
# euca-delete-bundle -b wind-new-2008-dc -p windowsserver2008_datacenter_x64.kvm.img
# euca-describe-images emi-F3ED3BCC
IMAGE	emi-F3ED3BCC	wind-new-2008-dc/windowsserver2008_datacenter_x64.kvm.img.manifest.xml	123016462734	deregistered	public		x86_64	machine			windows	instance-store

( euca-delete-bundle ran successfully; check to see if filesystem is empty )

# ls -l /var/lib/eucalyptus/bukkits/wind-new-2008-dc/
total 0

{code}

Looks like this issue has been resolved with euca2ools version 2.0.2-0euca1.  Can you please confirm?

Regards,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

I have just replicated this behavior using Eucalyptus 3.1.0


[root@ns ~]# cd euca-centos-5.3-x86_64
[root@ns euca-centos-5.3-x86_64]# ls
centos.5-3.x86-64.img  kvm-kernel  xen-kernel
[root@ns euca-centos-5.3-x86_64]# euca-bundle-image -i centos.5-3.x86-64.img

[root@ns euca-centos-5.3-x86_64]# euca-upload-bundle -b beard -m /tmp/centos.5-3.x86-64.img.manifest.xml
Checking bucket: beard
Creating bucket: beard
Uploading manifest file
Uploading part: centos.5-3.x86-64.img.part.00

Uploaded image as beard/centos.5-3.x86-64.img.manifest.xml
[root@ns euca-centos-5.3-x86_64]# euca-register beard/centos.5-3.x86-64.img.manifest.xml
IMAGE   emi-C5B43D3C
[root@ns euca-centos-5.3-x86_64]# euca-describe-images | grep beard
IMAGE   emi-C5B43D3C    beard/centos.5-3.x86-64.img.manifest.xml        594888695171    available       public          i386    machine eki-B5FC3BF2    eri-24E83B9B            instance-store
[root@ns euca-centos-5.3-x86_64]# euca-deregister emi-C5B43D3C
IMAGE   emi-C5B43D3C
[root@ns euca-centos-5.3-x86_64]# euca-describe-images | grep beard
IMAGE   emi-C5B43D3C    beard/centos.5-3.x86-64.img.manifest.xml        594888695171    deregistered    public          i386    machine eki-B5FC3BF2    eri-24E83B9B            instance-store

[root@ns euca-centos-5.3-x86_64]# euca-delete-bundle -b beard -p centos.5-3.x86-64.img
[root@ns euca-centos-5.3-x86_64]# euca-delete-bundle -b beard -p centos.5-3.x86-64.img
problem parsing: /tmp/centos.5-3.x86-64.img.manifest.xml  <-------------------------------- This is the error message being referred to.

Confirmed.

Real issue is that "deleted" is not a valid value returned from euca-describe-images.

The status of the image (available, pending, failed) - this is from the latest documentation.  The documentation we have on our Contribtor's page does not contain information about this (http://www.eucalyptus.com/participate/code).

euca-describe-images should only need to be ran once.  No need to run it twice.  

*Reference Information*

# http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/CommandLineReference/ApiReference-cmd-DescribeImages.html

# (Old 2009-04-04 AWS Namespace documentation) http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2009-04-04/CommandLineReference/index.html?ApiReference-cmd-DescribeImages.html

Hey [~gholms],

Any update on this one?  You need any additional information.  Let me know and I will be happy to provide it.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

That tool's logic is all screwed up; it needs enough of a rework that I'd like to just rewrite it as I go through all the other tools.  Are you all right with waiting a bit longer or do you need a fix soon?

[~gholms],

Thanks for the update.  Yep, I can wait. Just wanted to make sure it was on your radar.  Thanks again.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

[~gholms], hit this during training classes today.  It's still broken in 2.1.4 ?

Ignore me, associated 3.0.0 fix version with Eucalyptus, not euca2ools ;)
